   21: %%
   22: -module(guard_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   25: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   26: 	 init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   27: 	 bad_arith/1,bad_tuple/1,test_heap_guards/1,guard_bifs/1,
   28: 	 type_tests/1,const_guard/1,
   29: 	 const_cond/1,basic_not/1,complex_not/1,
   30: 	 semicolon/1,complex_semicolon/1,comma/1,
   31: 	 or_guard/1,more_or_guards/1,
   32: 	 complex_or_guards/1,and_guard/1,
   33: 	 xor_guard/1,more_xor_guards/1,
   34: 	 build_in_guard/1,gbif/1,
   35: 	 t_is_boolean/1,is_function_2/1,
   36: 	 tricky/1,rel_ops/1,
   37: 	 basic_andalso_orelse/1,traverse_dcd/1,
   38: 	 check_qlc_hrl/1,andalso_semi/1,t_tuple_size/1,binary_part/1,
   39: 	 bad_constants/1]).
   40: 
   41: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   42: 
   43: -export([init/4]).
   44: -import(lists, [member/2]).
   45: 
   46: suite() ->
   47:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   48:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   49: 
   50: all() -> 
   51:     cases().
   52: 
   53: groups() -> 
   54:     [].
   55: 
   56: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   57:     Config.
   58: 
   59: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   60:     Config.
   61: 
   62: 
   63: cases() -> 
   64:     [bad_arith, bad_tuple, test_heap_guards, guard_bifs,
   65:      type_tests, const_guard, const_cond, basic_not,
   66:      complex_not, semicolon, complex_semicolon, comma,
   67:      or_guard, more_or_guards, complex_or_guards, and_guard,
   68:      xor_guard, more_xor_guards, build_in_guard,
   69:      gbif, t_is_boolean, is_function_2,
   70:      tricky, rel_ops, basic_andalso_orelse, traverse_dcd,
   71:      check_qlc_hrl, andalso_semi, t_tuple_size, binary_part,
   72:      bad_constants].
   73: 
   74: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   75:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   76:     Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   82:     test_lib:interpret(?MODULE),
   83:     true = lists:member(?MODULE, int:interpreted()),
   84:     Config.
   85: 
   86: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   87:     ok.
   88: 
   89: %% Test that a bad arithmetic operation in a guard works correctly.
   90: bad_arith(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     5 = bad_arith1(2, 3),
   92:     10 = bad_arith1(1, infinity),
   93:     10 = bad_arith1(infinity, 1),
   94:     42 = bad_div(24, 0),
   95:     ok.
   96: 
   97: bad_arith1(T1, T2) when T1+T2 < 10 ->
   98:     T1+T2;
   99: bad_arith1(_, _) ->
  100:     10.
  101: 
  102: bad_div(A, B) when A/B > 0 ->
  103:     A/B;
  104: bad_div(A, B) when A div B > 0 ->
  105:     A div B;
  106: bad_div(_A, _B) ->
  107:     42.
  108: 
  109: %% Test that bad arguments to element/2 are handled correctly.
  110: bad_tuple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  111:     error = bad_tuple1(a),
  112:     error = bad_tuple1({a, b}),
  113:     x = bad_tuple1({x, b}),
  114:     y = bad_tuple1({a, b, y}),
  115:     ok.
  116: 
  117: bad_tuple1(T) when element(1, T) == x -> x;
  118: bad_tuple1(T) when element(3, T) == y -> y;
  119: bad_tuple1(_) -> error.
  120: 
  121: %% .
  122: test_heap_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  123:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  124:     Tuple = {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx},
  125:     List = [a, list, is, built, here],
  126: 
  127:     try_fun(fun a_case/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
  128:     try_fun(fun a_case/1, [List], [List, List]),
  129:     try_fun(fun a_case/1, [a], [a]),
  130: 
  131:     try_fun(fun an_if/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
  132:     try_fun(fun an_if/1, [List], [List, List]),
  133:     try_fun(fun an_if/1, [a], [a]),
  134: 
  135:     try_fun(fun receive_test/1, [Tuple], [Tuple]),
  136:     try_fun(fun receive_test/1, [List], [List, List]),
  137:     try_fun(fun receive_test/1, [a], [a]),
  138:     ok.
  139: 
  140: a_case(V) ->
  141:     case V of
  142: 	T when T == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  143: 	    [T];
  144: 	L when L == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  145: 	    [L, L];
  146: 	a ->
  147: 	    [a]
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: an_if(V) ->
  151:     if
  152: 	V == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  153: 	    [V];
  154: 	V == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  155: 	    [V, V];
  156: 	V == a ->
  157: 	    [a]
  158:     end.
  159: 
  160: receive_test(V) ->
  161:     self() ! V,
  162:     a_receive().
  163: 
  164: a_receive() ->
  165:     receive
  166: 	T when T == {a, tuple, is, built, here, xxx} ->
  167: 	    [T];
  168: 	L when L == [a, list, is, built, here] ->
  169: 	    [L, L];
  170: 	a ->
  171: 	    [a]
  172:     end.
  173: 
  174: try_fun(Fun, Args, Result) ->
  175:     try_fun(16, Fun, Args, Result, []).
  176: 
  177: try_fun(0, _, _, _, _) ->
  178:     ok;
  179: try_fun(Iter, Fun, Args, Result, Filler) ->
  180:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, init, [self(),Fun,Args,list_to_tuple(Filler)]),
  181:     receive
  182: 	{'EXIT',Pid,{result,Result}} ->
  183: 	    try_fun(Iter-1, Fun, Args, Result, [0|Filler]);
  184: 	{'EXIT',Pid,{result,Other}} ->
  185: 	    io:format("Expected ~p; got ~p~n", [Result,Other]),
  186: 	    ct:fail(failed);
  187: 	Other ->
  188: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Other})
  189:     end.
  190: 
  191: init(_ReplyTo, Fun, Args, Filler) ->
  192:     Result = {result, apply(Fun, Args)},
  193:     dummy(Filler),
  194:     io:format("~p: result = ~p\n", [?LINE,Result]),
  195:     exit(Result).
  196: 
  197: dummy(_) ->
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: %% Test all guard bifs with nasty (but legal arguments).
  201: guard_bifs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  202:     Big = -237849247829874297658726487367328971246284736473821617265433,
  203:     Float = 387924.874,
  204: 
  205:     %% Succeeding use of guard bifs.
  206: 
  207:     try_gbif('abs/1', Big, -Big),
  208:     try_gbif('float/1', Big, float(Big)),
  209:     try_gbif('trunc/1', Float, 387924.0),
  210:     try_gbif('round/1', Float, 387925.0),
  211:     try_gbif('length/1', [], 0),
  212: 
  213:     try_gbif('length/1', [a], 1),
  214:     try_gbif('length/1', [a, b], 2),
  215:     try_gbif('length/1', lists:seq(0, 31), 32),
  216: 
  217:     try_gbif('hd/1', [a], a),
  218:     try_gbif('hd/1', [a, b], a),
  219: 
  220:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a], []),
  221:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a, b], [b]),
  222:     try_gbif('tl/1', [a, b, c], [b, c]),
  223: 
  224:     try_gbif('size/1', {}, 0),
  225:     try_gbif('size/1', {a}, 1),
  226:     try_gbif('size/1', {a, b}, 2),
  227:     try_gbif('size/1', {a, b, c}, 3),
  228:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([]), 0),
  229:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1]), 1),
  230:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1, 2]), 2),
  231:     try_gbif('size/1', list_to_binary([1, 2, 3]), 3),
  232: 
  233:     try_gbif('element/2', {x}, {1, x}),
  234:     try_gbif('element/2', {x, y}, {1, x}),
  235:     try_gbif('element/2', {x, y}, {2, y}),
  236: 
  237:     try_gbif('self/0', 0, self()),
  238:     try_gbif('node/0', 0, node()),
  239:     try_gbif('node/1', self(), node()),
  240: 
  241:     %% Failing use of guard bifs.
  242: 
  243:     try_fail_gbif('abs/1', Big, 1),
  244:     try_fail_gbif('abs/1', [], 1),
  245: 
  246:     try_fail_gbif('float/1', Big, 42),
  247:     try_fail_gbif('float/1', [], 42),
  248: 
  249:     try_fail_gbif('trunc/1', Float, 0.0),
  250:     try_fail_gbif('trunc/1', [], 0.0),
  251: 
  252:     try_fail_gbif('round/1', Float, 1.0),
  253:     try_fail_gbif('round/1', [], a),
  254: 
  255:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', [], 1),
  256:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', [a], 0),
  257:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', a, 0),
  258:     try_fail_gbif('length/1', {a}, 0),
  259: 
  260:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', [], 0),
  261:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', [a], x),
  262:     try_fail_gbif('hd/1', x, x),
  263: 
  264:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', [], 0),
  265:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', [a], x),
  266:     try_fail_gbif('tl/1', x, x),
  267: 
  268:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', {}, 1),
  269:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', [], 0),
  270:     try_fail_gbif('size/1', [a], 1),
  271: 
  272:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', {}, {1, x}),
  273:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', {x}, {1, y}),
  274:     try_fail_gbif('element/2', [], {1, z}),
  275: 
  276:     try_fail_gbif('self/0', 0, list_to_pid("<0.0.0>")),
  277:     try_fail_gbif('node/0', 0, xxxx),
  278:     try_fail_gbif('node/1', self(), xxx),
  279:     try_fail_gbif('node/1', yyy, xxx),
  280:     ok.
  281: 
  282: try_gbif(Id, X, Y) ->
  283:     case guard_bif(Id, X, Y) of
  284: 	{Id, X, Y} ->
  285: 	    io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- ok", [Id, X, Y]);
  286: 	Other ->
  287: 	    ok = io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- bad result: ~p\n",
  288: 			   [Id, X, Y, Other]),
  289: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  290:     end.
  291: 
  292: try_fail_gbif(Id, X, Y) ->
  293:     case catch guard_bif(Id, X, Y) of
  294: 	{'EXIT', {function_clause,[{?MODULE,guard_bif,[Id,X,Y],_}|_]}} ->
  295: 	    io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- ok", [Id,X,Y]);
  296: 	Other ->
  297: 	    ok = io:format("guard_bif(~p, ~p, ~p) -- bad result: ~p\n",
  298: 			   [Id, X, Y, Other]),
  299: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  300:     end.
  301: 
  302: guard_bif('abs/1', X, Y) when abs(X) == Y ->
  303:     {'abs/1', X, Y};
  304: guard_bif('float/1', X, Y) when float(X) == Y ->
  305:     {'float/1', X, Y};
  306: guard_bif('trunc/1', X, Y) when trunc(X) == Y ->
  307:     {'trunc/1', X, Y};
  308: guard_bif('round/1', X, Y) when round(X) == Y ->
  309:     {'round/1', X, Y};
  310: guard_bif('length/1', X, Y) when length(X) == Y ->
  311:     {'length/1', X, Y};
  312: guard_bif('hd/1', X, Y) when hd(X) == Y ->
  313:     {'hd/1', X, Y};
  314: guard_bif('tl/1', X, Y) when tl(X) == Y ->
  315:     {'tl/1', X, Y};
  316: guard_bif('size/1', X, Y) when size(X) == Y ->
  317:     {'size/1', X, Y};
  318: guard_bif('element/2', X, {Pos, Expected}) when element(Pos, X) == Expected ->
  319:     {'element/2', X, {Pos, Expected}};
  320: guard_bif('self/0', X, Y) when self() == Y ->
  321:     {'self/0', X, Y};
  322: guard_bif('node/0', X, Y) when node() == Y ->
  323:     {'node/0', X, Y};
  324: guard_bif('node/1', X, Y) when node(X) == Y ->
  325:     {'node/1', X, Y}.
  326: 
  327: %% Test the type tests.
  328: type_tests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  329:     Types = all_types(),
  330:     Tests = type_test_desc(),
  331:     put(errors, 0),
  332:     put(violations, 0),
  333:     type_tests(Tests, Types),
  334:     case {get(errors), get(violations)} of
  335: 	{0, 0} ->
  336: 	    ok;
  337: 	{0, N} ->
  338: 	    {comment, integer_to_list(N) ++ " standard violation(s)"};
  339: 	{Errors, Violations} ->
  340: 	    io:format("~p sub test(s) failed, ~p violation(s)",
  341: 		      [Errors, Violations]),
  342: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  343:     end.
  344: 
  345: type_tests([{Test, AllowedTypes}| T], AllTypes) ->
  346:     type_tests(Test, AllTypes, AllowedTypes),
  347:     type_tests(T, AllTypes);
  348: type_tests([], _) ->
  349:     ok.
  350: 
  351: type_tests(Test, [Type|T], Allowed) ->
  352:     {TypeTag, Value} = Type,
  353:     case member(TypeTag, Allowed) of
  354: 	true ->
  355: 	    case catch type_test(Test, Value) of
  356: 		Test ->
  357: 		    ok;
  358: 		_Other ->
  359: 		    io:format("Test ~p(~p) failed", [Test, Value]),
  360: 		    put(errors, get(errors) + 1)
  361: 	    end;
  362: 	false ->
  363: 	    case catch type_test(Test, Value) of
  364: 		{'EXIT',{function_clause,
  365: 			 [{?MODULE,type_test,[Test,Value],_}|_]}} ->
  366: 		    ok;
  367: 		{'EXIT',Other} ->
  368: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_error_reason,Other});
  369: 		tuple when is_function(Value) ->
  370: 		    io:format("Standard violation: Test ~p(~p) should fail",
  371: 			      [Test, Value]),
  372: 		    put(violations, get(violations) + 1);
  373: 		_Other ->
  374: 		    io:format("Test ~p(~p) succeeded (should fail)", [Test, Value]),
  375: 		    put(errors, get(errors) + 1)
  376: 	    end
  377:     end,
  378:     type_tests(Test, T, Allowed);
  379: type_tests(_, [], _) ->
  380:     ok.
  381: 
  382: all_types() ->
  383:     [{small, 42},
  384:      {big, 392742928742947293873938792874019287447829874290742},
  385:      {float, 3.14156},
  386:      {nil, []},
  387:      {cons, [a]},
  388:      {tuple, {a, b}},
  389:      {atom, xxxx},
  390:      {ref, make_ref()},
  391:      {pid, self()},
  392:      {port, make_port()},
  393:      {function, fun(X) -> X+1, "" end},
  394:      {binary, list_to_binary([])}].
  395: 
  396: type_test_desc() ->
  397:     [{integer, [small, big]},
  398:      {float, [float]},
  399:      {number, [small, big, float]},
  400:      {atom, [atom]},
  401:      {list, [cons, nil]},
  402:      {nonempty_list, [cons]},
  403:      {nil, [nil]},
  404:      {tuple, [tuple]},
  405:      {pid, [pid]},
  406:      {port, [port]},
  407:      {reference, [ref]},
  408:      {function, [function]}].
  409: 
  410: type_test(integer, X) when is_integer(X) ->
  411:     integer;
  412: type_test(float, X) when is_float(X) ->
  413:     float;
  414: type_test(number, X) when is_number(X) ->
  415:     number;
  416: type_test(atom, X) when is_atom(X) ->
  417:     atom;
  418: type_test(list, X) when is_list(X) ->
  419:     list;
  420: type_test(nonempty_list, [_]) ->
  421:     nonempty_list;
  422: type_test(nil, []) ->
  423:     nil;
  424: type_test(tuple, X) when is_tuple(X) ->
  425:     tuple;
  426: type_test(pid, X) when is_pid(X) ->
  427:     pid;
  428: type_test(reference, X) when is_reference(X) ->
  429:     reference;
  430: type_test(port, X) when is_port(X) ->
  431:     port;
  432: type_test(binary, X) when is_binary(X) ->
  433:     binary;
  434: type_test(function, X) when is_function(X) ->
  435:     function.
  436: 
  437: make_port() ->
  438:     hd(erlang:ports()).
  439: 
  440: const_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  441:     if
  442: 	(0 == 0) and ((0 == 0) or (0 == 0)) ->
  443: 	    ok
  444:     end.
  445: 
  446: 
  447: const_cond(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     ok = const_cond({}, 0),
  449:     ok = const_cond({a}, 1),
  450:     error = const_cond({a,b}, 3),
  451:     error = const_cond({a}, 0),
  452:     error = const_cond({a,b}, 1),
  453:     ok.
  454: 
  455: const_cond(T, Sz) ->
  456:     case T of
  457: 	_X when false -> never;
  458: 	_X when is_tuple(T), eq == eq, size(T) == Sz -> ok;
  459: 	_X when is_tuple(T), eq == leq, size(T) =< Sz -> ok;
  460: 	_X -> error
  461:     end.
  462: 
  463: basic_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  464:     True = id(true),
  465:     False = id(false),
  466:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  467:     A = id(5),
  468:     B = id(37.5),
  469:     C = id(-1),
  470:     D = id(5),
  471:     ATuple = {False,True,Glurf},
  472: 
  473:     check(fun() -> if not false -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  474:     check(fun() -> if not true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  475:     check(fun() -> if not False -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  476:     check(fun() -> if not True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  477: 
  478:     check(fun() -> if A > B -> gt; A < B -> lt; A == B -> eq end end, lt),
  479:     check(fun() -> if A > C -> gt; A < C -> lt; A == C -> eq end end, gt),
  480:     check(fun() -> if A > D -> gt; A < D -> lt; A == D -> eq end end, eq),
  481: 
  482:     check(fun() -> if not (7 > 453) -> le; not (7 < 453) -> ge;
  483: 		      not (7 == 453) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  484:     check(fun() -> if not (7 > -8) -> le; not (7 < -8) -> ge;
  485: 		      not (7 == -8) -> ne; true -> eq end end, ge),
  486:     check(fun() -> if not (7 > 7) -> le; not (7 < 7) -> ge;
  487: 		      not (7 == 7) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  488: 
  489:     check(fun() -> if not (A > B) -> le; not (A < B) -> ge;
  490: 		      not (A == B) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  491:     check(fun() -> if not (A > C) -> le; not (A < C) -> ge;
  492: 		      not (A == C) -> ne; true -> eq end end, ge),
  493:     check(fun() -> if not (A > D) -> le; not (A < D) -> ge;
  494: 		      not (A == D) -> ne; true -> eq end end, le),
  495: 
  496:     check(fun() -> if not element(1, ATuple) -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  497:     check(fun() -> if not element(2, ATuple) -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  498:     check(fun() -> if not element(3, ATuple) -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  499: 
  500:     check(fun() -> if not glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  501:     check(fun() -> if not Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  502: 
  503:     ok.
  504: 
  505: complex_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506:     ATuple = id({false,true,gurka}),
  507:     check(fun() -> if not(element(1, ATuple)) -> ok; true -> error end end, ok),
  508:     check(fun() -> if not(element(2, ATuple)) -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  509: 
  510:     check(fun() -> if not(element(3, ATuple) == gurka) -> ok;
  511: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  512:     check(fun() -> if not(element(3, ATuple) =/= gurka) -> ok;
  513: 		      true -> error end end, ok),
  514: 
  515:     check(fun() -> if {a,not(element(2, ATuple))} == {a,false} -> ok;
  516: 		      true -> error end end, ok),
  517:     check(fun() -> if {a,not(element(1, ATuple))} == {a,false} -> ok;
  518: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  519: 
  520:     check(fun() -> if not(element(1, ATuple) or element(3, ATuple)) -> ok;
  521: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  522: 
  523:     %% orelse
  524:     check(fun() -> if not(element(1, ATuple) orelse element(3, ATuple)) -> ok;
  525: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  526: 
  527:     ok.
  528: 
  529: semicolon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  530: 
  531:     %% True/false combined using ';' (literal atoms).
  532: 
  533:     check(fun() -> if true; false -> ok end end, ok),
  534:     check(fun() -> if false; true -> ok end end, ok),
  535:     check(fun() -> if true; true -> ok end end, ok),
  536:     check(fun() -> if false; false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  537:     check(fun() ->
  538: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if false; false -> ok end),
  539: 		  exit
  540: 	  end, exit),
  541: 
  542:     %% True/false combined used ';'.
  543: 
  544:     True = id(true),
  545:     False = id(false),
  546: 
  547:     check(fun() -> if True; False -> ok end end, ok),
  548:     check(fun() -> if False; True -> ok end end, ok),
  549:     check(fun() -> if True; True -> ok end end, ok),
  550:     check(fun() -> if False; False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  551:     check(fun() ->
  552: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if False; False -> ok end),
  553: 		  exit
  554: 	  end, exit),
  555: 
  556:     %% Combine true/false with a non-boolean value.
  557:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  558: 
  559: 
  560:     check(fun() -> if True; Glurf -> ok end end, ok),
  561:     check(fun() -> if Glurf; True -> ok end end, ok),
  562:     check(fun() -> if Glurf; Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  563:     check(fun() -> if False; Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  564:     check(fun() -> if Glurf; False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  565:     check(fun() ->
  566: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if Glurf; Glurf -> ok end),
  567: 		  exit
  568: 	  end, exit),
  569: 
  570:     %% Combine true/false with errors.
  571: 
  572:     ATuple = id({false,true,gurka}),
  573: 
  574:     check(fun() -> if True; element(42, ATuple) -> ok end end, ok),
  575:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple); True -> ok end end, ok),
  576:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple); element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  577: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  578:     check(fun() -> if False; element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  579: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  580:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple);
  581: 		      False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  582:     check(fun() ->
  583: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  584: 		      (catch if element(42, ATuple);
  585: 				element(42, ATuple) -> ok end),
  586: 		  exit
  587: 	  end, exit),
  588: 
  589:     ok.
  590: 
  591: complex_semicolon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  592:     ok = csemi1(int, {blurf}),
  593:     ok = csemi1(string, {blurf}),
  594:     ok = csemi1(float, [a]),
  595:     error = csemi1(35, 42),
  596: 
  597:     %% 2
  598:     ok = csemi2({}, {a,b,c}),
  599:     ok = csemi2({1,3.5}, {a,b,c}),
  600:     ok = csemi2(dum, {a,b,c}),
  601: 
  602:     ok = csemi2({45,-19.3}, {}),
  603:     ok = csemi2({45,-19.3}, {dum}),
  604:     ok = csemi2({45,-19.3}, {dum,dum}),
  605: 
  606:     error = csemi2({45}, {dum}),
  607:     error = csemi2([], {dum}),
  608:     error = csemi2({dum}, []),
  609:     error = csemi2([], []),
  610: 
  611:     %% 3
  612:     csemi3(fun csemi3a/4),
  613:     csemi3(fun csemi3b/4),
  614:     csemi3(fun csemi3c/4),
  615: 
  616:     %% 4
  617:     csemi4(fun csemi4a/4),
  618:     csemi4(fun csemi4b/4),
  619:     csemi4(fun csemi4c/4),
  620:     csemi4(fun csemi4d/4),
  621: 
  622:     %% 4, 'orelse' instead of 'or'
  623:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_a/4),
  624:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_b/4),
  625:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_c/4),
  626:     csemi4_orelse(fun csemi4_orelse_d/4),
  627: 
  628:     ok.
  629: 
  630: csemi1(Type, Val) when is_list(Val), Type == float;
  631: 		       Type == int; Type == string -> ok;
  632: csemi1(_, _) -> error.
  633: 
  634: csemi2(A, B) when size(A) > 1; size(B) > 2 -> ok;
  635: csemi2(_, _) -> error.
  636: 
  637: csemi3(Csemi3) ->
  638:     ok = Csemi3({}, {a,b,c}, [0], [0]),
  639:     ok = Csemi3({1,3.5}, {a,b,c}, -1, -1),
  640:     ok = Csemi3(dum, {a,b,c}, 0.0, 0.0),
  641:     ok = Csemi3(dum, {c}, b, a),
  642:     ok = Csemi3(dum, <<1,2,3>>, 0.0, 0.0),
  643:     ok = Csemi3(<<3.5/float>>, {a,b,c}, -1, -1),
  644: 
  645:     ok = Csemi3({45,-19.3}, {}, [], []),
  646:     ok = Csemi3({45,-19.3}, {dum}, 42, 42),
  647:     ok = Csemi3({45,-19.3}, {dum,dum}, 33, 33),
  648: 
  649:     ok = Csemi3({45}, {dum}, 1.0, 0),
  650:     ok = Csemi3([a], {dum}, 1.0, 0),
  651:     ok = Csemi3({dum}, [], 1.0, 0),
  652:     ok = Csemi3([], [], 1.0, 0),
  653:     ok = Csemi3(blurf, {dum}, 1.0, 0),
  654:     ok = Csemi3({a}, blurf, 1.0, 0),
  655:     ok = Csemi3([a], [dum], 1.0, 0),
  656:     ok = Csemi3({dum}, [], 1.0, 0),
  657:     ok = Csemi3([], [], 1.0, 0),
  658: 
  659:     error = Csemi3({45}, {dum}, 0, 0),
  660:     error = Csemi3([a], {dum}, 0, 0),
  661:     error = Csemi3({dum}, [], 0, 0),
  662:     error = Csemi3([], [], 0, 0),
  663:     ok.
  664: 
  665: csemi3a(A, B, X, Y) when X > Y; size(A) > 1; size(B) > 2 -> ok;
  666: csemi3a(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  667: 
  668: csemi3b(A, B, X, Y) when size(A) > 1; X > Y; size(B) > 2 -> ok;
  669: csemi3b(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  670: 
  671: csemi3c(A, B, X, Y) when size(A) > 1; size(B) > 2; X > Y -> ok;
  672: csemi3c(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  673: 
  674: 
  675: csemi4(Test) ->
  676:     ok = Test({a,b}, 2, {c,d}, 2),
  677:     ok = Test({1,2,3}, 0, [], 0),
  678:     ok = Test({}, 2, blurf, 0),
  679:     ok = Test({}, 2, {1}, 2),
  680: 
  681:     error = Test([], 4, {}, 0),
  682:     error = Test({}, 0, [a,b], 4),
  683:     error = Test({}, 0, [a,b], 0),
  684:     error = Test([], 0, {}, 0),
  685:     error = Test({}, 0, {}, 0),
  686: 
  687:     ok.
  688: 
  689: csemi4a(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) or (X > 1);
  690: 			 (size(B) > 1) or (Y > 1) -> ok;
  691: csemi4a(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  692: 
  693: csemi4b(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) or (size(A) > 1);
  694: 			 (size(B) > 1) or (Y > 1) -> ok;
  695: csemi4b(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  696: 
  697: csemi4c(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) or (X > 1);
  698: 			 (Y > 1) or (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  699: csemi4c(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  700: 
  701: csemi4d(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) or (size(A) > 1);
  702: 			 (Y > 1) or (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  703: csemi4d(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  704: 
  705: 
  706: csemi4_orelse(Test) ->
  707:     ok = Test({a,b}, 2, {c,d}, 2),
  708:     ok = Test({1,2,3}, 0, [], 0),
  709:     ok = Test({}, 2, blurf, 0),
  710:     ok = Test({}, 2, {1}, 2),
  711: 
  712:     error = Test([], 1, {}, 0),
  713: 
  714:     ok.
  715: 
  716: csemi4_orelse_a(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) orelse (X > 1);
  717: 				 (size(B) > 1) orelse (Y > 1) -> ok;
  718: csemi4_orelse_a(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  719: 
  720: csemi4_orelse_b(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) orelse (size(A) > 1);
  721: 				 (size(B) > 1) orelse (Y > 1) -> ok;
  722: csemi4_orelse_b(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  723: 
  724: csemi4_orelse_c(A, X, B, Y) when (size(A) > 1) orelse (X > 1);
  725: 				 (Y > 1) orelse (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  726: csemi4_orelse_c(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  727: 
  728: csemi4_orelse_d(A, X, B, Y) when (X > 1) or (size(A) > 1);
  729: 				 (Y > 1) or (size(B) > 1) -> ok;
  730: csemi4_orelse_d(_, _, _, _) -> error.
  731: 
  732: 
  733: comma(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  734: 
  735:     %% ',' combinations of literal true/false.
  736: 
  737:     check(fun() -> if true, false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  738:     check(fun() -> if false, true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  739:     check(fun() -> if true, true -> ok end end, ok),
  740:     check(fun() -> if false, false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  741:     check(fun() ->
  742: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  743: 		      (catch if true, false -> ok;
  744: 				false, true -> ok;
  745: 				false, false -> ok
  746: 			     end),
  747: 		  exit
  748: 	  end, exit),
  749: 
  750:     %% ',' combinations of true/false in variables.
  751: 
  752:     True = id(true),
  753:     False = id(false),
  754: 
  755:     check(fun() -> if True, False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  756:     check(fun() -> if False, True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  757:     check(fun() -> if True, True -> ok end end, ok),
  758:     check(fun() -> if False, False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  759:     check(fun() ->
  760: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  761: 		      (catch if True, False -> ok;
  762: 				False, True -> ok;
  763: 				False, False -> ok
  764: 			     end),
  765: 		  exit
  766: 	  end, exit),
  767: 
  768:     %% ',' combinations of true/false, and non-boolean in variables.
  769: 
  770:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  771: 
  772:     check(fun() -> if True, Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  773:     check(fun() -> if Glurf, True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  774:     check(fun() -> if True, True -> ok end end, ok),
  775:     check(fun() -> if Glurf, Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  776:     check(fun() ->
  777: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  778: 		      (catch if True, Glurf -> ok;
  779: 				Glurf, True -> ok;
  780: 				Glurf, Glurf -> ok
  781: 			     end),
  782: 		  exit
  783: 	  end, exit),
  784: 
  785:     %% ',' combinations of true/false with errors.
  786:     ATuple = id({a,b,c}),
  787: 
  788:     check(fun() -> if True, element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  789: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  790:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple), True -> ok;
  791: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  792:     check(fun() -> if True, True -> ok end end, ok),
  793:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple), element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  794: 		      true -> error end end, error),
  795:     check(fun() ->
  796: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
  797: 		      (catch if True, element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  798: 				element(42, ATuple), True -> ok;
  799: 				element(42, ATuple), element(42, ATuple) -> ok
  800: 			     end),
  801: 		  exit
  802: 	  end, exit),
  803: 
  804:     ok.
  805: 
  806: or_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  807:     True = id(true),
  808:     False = id(false),
  809:     Glurf = id(glurf),
  810: 
  811:     %% 'or' combinations of literal true/false.
  812:     check(fun() -> if true or false -> ok end end, ok),
  813:     check(fun() -> if false or true -> ok end end, ok),
  814:     check(fun() -> if true or true -> ok end end, ok),
  815:     check(fun() -> if false or false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  816: 
  817:     check(fun() -> if glurf or true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  818:     check(fun() -> if true or glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  819:     check(fun() -> if glurf or glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  820: 
  821:     check(fun() ->
  822: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if false or false -> ok end),
  823: 		  exit
  824: 	  end, exit),
  825: 
  826: 
  827:     %% 'or' combinations using variables containing true/false.
  828:     check(fun() -> if True or False -> ok end end, ok),
  829:     check(fun() -> if False or True -> ok end end, ok),
  830:     check(fun() -> if True or True -> ok end end, ok),
  831:     check(fun() -> if False or False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  832: 
  833:     check(fun() -> if True or Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  834:     check(fun() -> if Glurf or True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  835:     check(fun() -> if Glurf or Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
  836: 
  837:     check(fun() ->
  838: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if False or False -> ok end),
  839: 		  exit
  840: 	  end, exit),
  841: 
  842:     ok.
  843: 
  844: more_or_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  845:     True = id(true),
  846:     False = id(false),
  847:     ATuple = id({false,true,gurka}),
  848: 
  849:     check(fun() ->
  850: 		  if element(42, ATuple) or False -> ok;
  851: 		     true -> error end
  852: 	  end, error),
  853: 
  854:     check(fun() ->
  855: 		  if False or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  856: 		     true -> error end
  857: 	  end, error),
  858: 
  859:     check(fun() ->
  860: 		  if element(18, ATuple) or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  861: 		     true -> error end
  862: 	  end, error),
  863: 
  864:     check(fun() ->
  865: 		  if True or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  866: 		     true -> error end
  867: 	  end, error),
  868: 
  869:     check(fun() ->
  870: 		  if element(42, ATuple) or True -> ok;
  871: 		     true -> error end
  872: 	  end, error),
  873: 
  874:     check(fun() ->
  875: 		  if element(1, ATuple) or element(42, ATuple) or True -> ok;
  876: 		     true -> error end
  877: 	  end, error),
  878: 
  879:     check(fun() ->
  880: 		  if element(1, ATuple) or True or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  881: 		     true -> error end
  882: 	  end, error),
  883: 
  884:     check(fun() ->
  885: 		  if
  886: 		      (<<False:8>> == <<0>>) or element(2, ATuple) -> ok;
  887: 		      true -> error end
  888: 	  end, error),
  889: 
  890:     check(fun() ->
  891: 		  if
  892: 		      element(2, ATuple) or (<<True:8>> == <<1>>) -> ok;
  893: 		      true -> error end
  894: 	  end, error),
  895: 
  896:     check(fun() ->
  897: 		  if element(2, ATuple) or element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
  898: 		     true -> error end
  899: 	  end, error),
  900: 
  901:     check(fun() ->
  902: 		  if
  903: 		      element(1, ATuple) or
  904: 		      element(2, ATuple) or
  905: 		      element(19, ATuple) -> ok;
  906: 		      true -> error end
  907: 	  end, error),
  908:     ok.
  909: 
  910: complex_or_guards(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  911:     %% complex_or_1/2
  912:     ok = complex_or_1({a,b,c,d}, {1,2,3}),
  913:     ok = complex_or_1({a,b,c,d}, {1}),
  914:     ok = complex_or_1({a}, {1,2,3}),
  915:     error = complex_or_1({a}, {1}),
  916: 
  917:     error = complex_or_1(1, 2),
  918:     error = complex_or_1([], {a,b,c,d}),
  919:     error = complex_or_1({a,b,c,d}, []),
  920: 
  921: 
  922:     %% complex_or_2/1
  923:     ok = complex_or_2({true,{}}),
  924:     ok = complex_or_2({false,{a}}),
  925:     ok = complex_or_2({false,{a,b,c}}),
  926:     ok = complex_or_2({true,{a,b,c,d}}),
  927: 
  928:     error = complex_or_2({blurf,{a,b,c}}),
  929: 
  930:     error = complex_or_2({true}),
  931:     error = complex_or_2({true,no_tuple}),
  932:     error = complex_or_2({true,[]}),
  933: 
  934:     %% complex_or_3/2
  935:     ok = complex_or_3({true}, {}),
  936:     ok = complex_or_3({false}, {a}),
  937:     ok = complex_or_3({false}, {a,b,c}),
  938:     ok = complex_or_3({true}, {a,b,c,d}),
  939:     ok = complex_or_3({false}, <<1,2,3>>),
  940:     ok = complex_or_3({true}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  941: 
  942:     error = complex_or_3(blurf, {a,b,c}),
  943: 
  944:     error = complex_or_3({false}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  945:     error = complex_or_3([], <<1,2>>),
  946:     error = complex_or_3({true}, 45),
  947:     error = complex_or_3(<<>>, <<>>),
  948: 
  949:     %% complex_or_4/2
  950:     ok = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3>>, {true}),
  951:     ok = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3>>, {false}),
  952:     ok = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3>>, {true}),
  953:     ok = complex_or_4({1,2,3}, {true}),
  954:     error = complex_or_4({1,2,3,4}, {false}),
  955: 
  956:     error = complex_or_4(<<1,2,3,4>>, []),
  957:     error = complex_or_4([], {true}),
  958: 
  959:     %% complex_or_5/2
  960:     ok = complex_or_5(<<1>>, {false}),
  961:     ok = complex_or_5(<<1,2,3>>, {true}),
  962:     ok = complex_or_5(<<1,2,3,4>>, {false}),
  963:     ok = complex_or_5({1,2,3}, {false}),
  964:     ok = complex_or_5({1,2,3,4}, {false}),
  965: 
  966:     error = complex_or_5(blurf, {false}),
  967:     error = complex_or_5(<<1>>, klarf),
  968:     error = complex_or_5(blurf, klarf),
  969: 
  970:     %% complex_or_6/2
  971:     ok = complex_or_6({true,true}, {1,2,3,4}),
  972:     ok = complex_or_6({true,true}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  973:     ok = complex_or_6({false,false}, <<1,2,3,4>>),
  974:     ok = complex_or_6({false,true}, <<1>>),
  975:     ok = complex_or_6({true,false}, {1}),
  976:     ok = complex_or_6({true,true}, {1}),
  977: 
  978:     error = complex_or_6({false,false}, {1}),
  979: 
  980:     error = complex_or_6({true}, {1,2,3,4}),
  981:     error = complex_or_6({}, {1,2,3,4}),
  982:     error = complex_or_6([], {1,2,3,4}),
  983:     error = complex_or_6([], {1,2,3,4}),
  984:     error = complex_or_6({true,false}, klurf),
  985: 
  986:     ok.
  987: 
  988: complex_or_1(A, B) ->
  989:     if
  990: 	((3 < size(A)) and (size(A) < 9)) or
  991: 	((2 < size(B)) and (size(B) < 7)) -> ok;
  992: 	true -> error
  993:     end.
  994: 
  995: complex_or_2(Tuple) ->
  996:     if
  997: 	element(1, Tuple) or not (size(element(2, Tuple)) > 3) -> ok;
  998: 	true -> error
  999:     end.
 1000: 
 1001: complex_or_3(A, B) ->
 1002:     if
 1003: 	not (size(B) > 3) or element(1, A) -> ok;
 1004: 	true -> error
 1005:     end.
 1006: 
 1007: complex_or_4(A, B) ->
 1008:     if
 1009: 	not (is_tuple(A) and (size(A) > 3)) or element(1, B) -> ok;
 1010: 	true -> error
 1011:     end.
 1012: 
 1013: complex_or_5(A, B) ->
 1014:     if
 1015: 	not (is_tuple(A) or (size(A) > 3)) or not element(1, B) -> ok;
 1016: 	true -> error
 1017:     end.
 1018: 
 1019: complex_or_6(A, B) ->
 1020:     if
 1021: 	not (not element(1, A) and not element(2, A)) or
 1022: 	not (not (size(B) > 3)) -> ok;
 1023: 	true -> error
 1024:     end.
 1025: 
 1026: and_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1027: 
 1028:     %% 'and' combinations of literal true/false.
 1029: 
 1030:     check(fun() -> if true and false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1031:     check(fun() -> if false and true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1032:     check(fun() -> if true and true -> ok end end, ok),
 1033:     check(fun() -> if false and false -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1034: 
 1035:     check(fun() -> if glurf and true -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1036:     check(fun() -> if true and glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1037:     check(fun() -> if glurf and glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1038: 
 1039:     check(fun() ->
 1040: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1041: 		      (catch if true and false -> ok;
 1042: 				false and true -> ok;
 1043: 				false and false -> ok
 1044: 			     end),
 1045: 		  exit
 1046: 	  end, exit),
 1047: 
 1048:     %% 'and' combinations of true/false in variables.
 1049: 
 1050:     True = id(true),
 1051:     False = id(false),
 1052: 
 1053:     check(fun() -> if True and False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1054:     check(fun() -> if False and True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1055:     check(fun() -> if True and True -> ok end end, ok),
 1056:     check(fun() -> if False and False -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1057:     check(fun() ->
 1058: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1059: 		      (catch if True and False -> ok;
 1060: 				False and True -> ok;
 1061: 				False and False -> ok
 1062: 			     end),
 1063: 		  exit
 1064: 	  end, exit),
 1065: 
 1066:     %% 'and' combinations of true/false and a non-boolean in variables.
 1067: 
 1068:     Glurf = id(glurf),
 1069: 
 1070:     check(fun() -> if True and Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1071:     check(fun() -> if Glurf and True -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1072:     check(fun() -> if True and True -> ok end end, ok),
 1073:     check(fun() -> if Glurf and Glurf -> ok; true -> error end end, error),
 1074:     check(fun() ->
 1075: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1076: 		      (catch if True and Glurf -> ok;
 1077: 				Glurf and True -> ok;
 1078: 				Glurf and Glurf -> ok
 1079: 			     end),
 1080: 		  exit
 1081: 	  end, exit),
 1082: 
 1083:     %% 'and' combinations of true/false with errors.
 1084:     ATuple = id({a,b,c}),
 1085: 
 1086:     check(fun() -> if True and element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
 1087: 		      true -> error end end, error),
 1088:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple) and True -> ok;
 1089: 		      true -> error end end, error),
 1090:     check(fun() -> if True and True -> ok end end, ok),
 1091:     check(fun() -> if element(42, ATuple) and element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
 1092: 		      true -> error end end, error),
 1093:     check(fun() ->
 1094: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} =
 1095: 		      (catch if True and element(42, ATuple) -> ok;
 1096: 				element(42, ATuple) and True -> ok;
 1097: 				element(42, ATuple) and element(42, ATuple) -> ok
 1098: 			     end),
 1099: 		  exit
 1100: 	  end, exit),
 1101: 
 1102:     ok = relprod({'Set',a,b}, {'Set',a,b}),
 1103: 
 1104:     ok.
 1105: 
 1106: relprod(R1, R2) when (erlang:size(R1) =:= 3) and (erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set'), (erlang:size(R2) =:= 3) and (erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set') ->
 1107:     ok.

 1112:     %% 'xor' combinations of literal true/false.

 1118: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if false xor false -> ok end),
 1119: 		  exit
 1120: 	  end, exit),
 1121:     check(fun() ->
 1122: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if true xor true -> ok end),
 1123: 		  exit
 1124: 	  end, exit),

 1138: 		  exit

 1141: 		  {'EXIT',{if_clause,_}} = (catch if True xor True -> ok end),
 1142: 		  exit
 1143: 	  end, exit),
 1144: 
 1145:     ok.

 1275: 
 1276: -define(T(Op,A,B),
 1277: 	ok = if A Op B -> ok; true -> error end,
 1278: 	ok = if not (A Op B) -> error; true -> ok end,
 1279: 	(fun(X, Y, True, False) ->
 1280: 		 ok = if X Op Y -> ok; true -> error end,
 1281: 		 ok = if False; X Op Y; False -> ok; true -> error end,
 1282: 		 ok = if X Op Y, True -> ok; true -> error end,
 1283: 		 ok = if not (X Op Y) -> error; true -> ok end,
 1284: 		 ok = if False; not (X Op Y); False -> error; true -> ok end
 1285: 	 end)(id(A), id(B), id(true), id(false))).
 1286: 
 1287: -define(F(Op,A,B),
 1288: 	ok = if A Op B -> error; true -> ok end,
 1289: 	ok = if not (A Op B) -> ok; true -> error end,
 1290: 	(fun(X, Y, True, False) ->
 1291: 		 ok = if X Op Y -> error; true -> ok end,
 1292: 		 ok = if False; X Op Y; False -> error; true -> ok end,
 1293: 		 ok = if not (X Op Y); False -> ok; true -> error end,
 1294: 		 ok = if not (X Op Y), True -> ok; true -> error end
 1295: 	 end)(id(A), id(B), id(true), id(false))).

 1334: basic_andalso_orelse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1335:     T = id({type,integers,23,42}),
 1336:     65 = if
 1337: 	     ((element(1, T) =:= type) andalso (size(T) =:= 4) andalso
 1338: 	      element(2, T) == integers) ->
 1339: 		 element(3, T) + element(4, T);
 1340: 	     true -> error
 1341: 	 end,
 1342:     65 = case [] of
 1343: 	     [] when ((element(1, T) =:= type) andalso (size(T) =:= 4) andalso
 1344: 		      element(2, T) == integers) ->
 1345: 		 element(3, T) + element(4, T)
 1346: 	 end,
 1347: 
 1348:     42 = basic_rt({type,integers,40,2}),
 1349:     5.0 = basic_rt({vector,{3.0,4.0}}),
 1350:     20 = basic_rt(['+',3,7]),
 1351:     {'Set',a,b} = basic_rt({{'Set',a,b},{'Set',a,b}}),
 1352:     12 = basic_rt({klurf,4}),
 1353: 
 1354:     error = basic_rt({type,integers,40,2,3}),
 1355:     error = basic_rt({kalle,integers,40,2}),
 1356:     error = basic_rt({kalle,integers,40,2}),
 1357:     error = basic_rt({1,2}),
 1358:     error = basic_rt([]),
 1359: 
 1360:     RelProdBody =
 1361: 	fun(R1, R2) ->
 1362: 		if
 1363: 		    (erlang:size(R1) =:= 3) andalso (erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set'),
 1364: 		    (erlang:size(R2) =:= 3) andalso (erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set') ->
 1365: 			ok
 1366: 		end
 1367: 	end,
 1368: 
 1369:     ok = RelProdBody({'Set',a,b}, {'Set',a,b}),
 1370:     ok.
 1371: 
 1372: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso size(T) =:= 4 andalso element(1, T) =:= type andalso
 1373: 		 element(2, T) == integers ->
 1374:     element(3, T) + element(4, T);
 1375: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso size(T) =:= 2 andalso element(1, T) =:= vector ->
 1376:     {X,Y} = element(2, T),
 1377:     if
 1378: 	is_float(X), is_float(Y) ->
 1379: 	    math:sqrt(X*X+Y*Y)
 1380:     end;
 1381: basic_rt(['+',A,B]) ->
 1382:     2*id(A+B);
 1383: basic_rt({R1,R2}) when erlang:size(R1) =:= 3 andalso erlang:element(1,R1) =:= 'Set',
 1384: 		       erlang:size(R2) =:= 3 andalso erlang:element(1,R2) =:= 'Set' ->
 1385:     R1 = id(R1),
 1386:     R2 = id(R2),
 1387:     R1;
 1388: basic_rt(T) when is_tuple(T) andalso size(T) =:= 2 andalso element(1, T) =:= klurf ->
 1389:     3*id(element(2, T));
 1390: basic_rt(_) ->
 1391:     error.
 1392: 
 1393: traverse_dcd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1394:     L0 = [{log_header,dcd_log,"1.0",a,b,c},{log_header,dcd_log,"2.0",a,b,c},
 1395: 	  {log_header,dcd_log,"0.0",a,b,c},blurf],
 1396:     {cont,[{log_header,dcd_log,"0.0",a,b,c},blurf],log,funny} =
 1397: 	traverse_dcd({cont,L0}, log, funny),
 1398:     L1 = [{log_header,dcd_log,"1.0"}],
 1399:     {cont,L1,log,funny} = traverse_dcd({cont,L1}, log, funny),
 1400:     L2 = [{a,tuple}],
 1401:     {cont,L2,log,funny} = traverse_dcd({cont,L2}, log, funny),
 1402:     ok.
 1403: 
 1404: %% The function starts out with 3 arguments in {x,0}, {x,1}, {x,2}.
 1405: %% The outer match of a two tuple will places the first element in {x,3} and
 1406: %% second in {x,4}. The guard for the first clause must make ensure that all of those
 1407: %% registers are restored before entering the second clause.
 1408: %%
 1409: %% (From mnesia_checkpoint.erl, modified.)
 1410: 
 1411: traverse_dcd({Cont,[LogH|Rest]},Log,Fun)
 1412:   when is_tuple(LogH) andalso size(LogH) =:= 6 andalso element(1, LogH) =:= log_header
 1413:        andalso erlang:element(2,LogH) == dcd_log,
 1414:        is_tuple(LogH) andalso size(LogH) =:= 6 andalso element(1, LogH) =:= log_header
 1415:        andalso erlang:element(3,LogH) >= "1.0" ->
 1416:     traverse_dcd({Cont,Rest},Log,Fun);
 1417: traverse_dcd({Cont,Recs},Log,Fun) ->
 1418:     {Cont,Recs,Log,Fun}.
 1419: 
 1420: 
 1421: check_qlc_hrl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1422:     St = {r1,false,dum},
 1423:     foo = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3}], St),
 1424:     foo = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 1425:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [], St),
 1426:     St = cqlc(qlc, blurf, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 1427:     St = cqlc(q, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], St),
 1428:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b,c], St),
 1429:     St = cqlc(qlc, q, [a,b], St),
 1430:     {r1,true,kalle} = cqlc(qlc, q, [{lc,1,2,3},b], {r1,true,kalle}),
 1431:     ok.
 1432: 
 1433: %% From erl_lint.erl; original name was check_qlc_hrl/4.
 1434: cqlc(M, F, As, St) ->
 1435:     Arity = length(As),
 1436:     case As of
 1437:         [{lc,_L,_E,_Qs}|_] when M =:= qlc, F =:= q,
 1438:                                 Arity < 3,
 1439:                                 not (((element(1, St) =:= r1) orelse fail) and (size(St) =:= 3) and element(2, St)) ->
 1440:             foo;
 1441:         _ ->
 1442:             St
 1443:     end.
 1444: 
 1445: %% OTP-7679: Thanks to Hunter Morris.
 1446: andalso_semi(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1447:     ok = andalso_semi_foo(0),
 1448:     ok = andalso_semi_foo(1),
 1449:     fc(catch andalso_semi_foo(2)),
 1450: 
 1451:     ok = andalso_semi_bar([a,b,c]),
 1452:     ok = andalso_semi_bar(1),
 1453:     fc(catch andalso_semi_bar([a,b])),
 1454:     ok.
 1455: 
 1456: andalso_semi_foo(Bar) when is_integer(Bar) andalso Bar =:= 0; Bar =:= 1 ->
 1457:     ok.
 1458: 
 1459: andalso_semi_bar(Bar) when is_list(Bar) andalso length(Bar) =:= 3; Bar =:= 1 ->
 1460:     ok.
 1461: 
 1462: 
 1463: t_tuple_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1464:     10 = do_tuple_size({1,2,3,4}),
 1465:     fc(catch do_tuple_size({1,2,3})),
 1466:     fc(catch do_tuple_size(42)),
 1467: 
 1468:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size({a,b,c}),
 1469:     error = ludicrous_tuple_size([a,b,c]),
 1470: 
 1471:     ok.
 1472: 
 1473: do_tuple_size(T) when tuple_size(T) =:= 4 ->
 1474:     {A,B,C,D} = T,
 1475:     A+B+C+D.
 1476: 
 1477: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1478:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#7777777777777777777777777777777777 -> ok;
 1479: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1480:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#10000000000000000 -> ok;
 1481: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1482:   when tuple_size(T) =:= (1 bsl 64) - 1 -> ok;
 1483: ludicrous_tuple_size(T)
 1484:   when tuple_size(T) =:= 16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF -> ok;
 1485: ludicrous_tuple_size(_) -> error.
 1486: 
 1487: %%
 1488: %% The binary_part/2,3 guard BIFs
 1489: %%
 1490: -define(MASK_ERROR(EXPR),mask_error((catch (EXPR)))).
 1491: mask_error({'EXIT',{Err,_}}) ->
 1492:     Err;
 1493: mask_error(Else) ->
 1494:     Else.
 1495: 
 1496: %% Tests the binary_part/2,3 guard (GC) bif's.
 1497: binary_part(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1498:     %% This is more or less a copy of what the guard_SUITE in emulator
 1499:     %% does to cover the guard bif's
 1500:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>),
 1501:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>),
 1502:     error = bptest(<<1>>),
 1503:     error = bptest(<<>>),
 1504:     error = bptest(apa),
 1505:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>),
 1506:     %% With one variable (pos)
 1507:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 1508:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 1509:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1),
 1510:     error = bptest(<<>>,1),
 1511:     error = bptest(apa,1),
 1512:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1),
 1513:     %% With one variable (length)
 1514:     1 = bptesty(<<1,2,3>>,1),
 1515:     2 = bptesty(<<2,1,3>>,1),
 1516:     error = bptesty(<<1>>,1),
 1517:     error = bptesty(<<>>,1),
 1518:     error = bptesty(apa,1),
 1519:     3 = bptesty(<<2,3,3>>,2),
 1520:     %% With one variable (whole tuple)
 1521:     1 = bptestx(<<1,2,3>>,{1,1}),
 1522:     2 = bptestx(<<2,1,3>>,{1,1}),
 1523:     error = bptestx(<<1>>,{1,1}),
 1524:     error = bptestx(<<>>,{1,1}),
 1525:     error = bptestx(apa,{1,1}),
 1526:     3 = bptestx(<<2,3,3>>,{1,2}),
 1527:     %% With two variables
 1528:     1 = bptest(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 1529:     2 = bptest(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 1530:     error = bptest(<<1>>,1,1),
 1531:     error = bptest(<<>>,1,1),
 1532:     error = bptest(apa,1,1),
 1533:     3 = bptest(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 1534:     %% Direct (autoimported) call, these will be evaluated by the compiler...
 1535:     <<2>> = binary_part(<<1,2,3>>,1,1),
 1536:     <<1>> = binary_part(<<2,1,3>>,1,1),
 1537:     %% Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 1538:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<1>>,1,1)),
 1539:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(<<>>,1,1)),
 1540:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(binary_part(apa,1,1)),
 1541:     <<3,3>> = binary_part(<<2,3,3>>,1,2),
 1542:     %% Direct call through apply
 1543:     <<2>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1,2,3>>,1,1]),
 1544:     <<1>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,1,3>>,1,1]),
 1545:     %% Compiler warnings due to constant evaluation expected (3)
 1546:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<1>>,1,1])),
 1547:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<>>,1,1])),
 1548:     badarg = ?MASK_ERROR(apply(erlang,binary_part,[apa,1,1])),
 1549:     <<3,3>> = apply(erlang,binary_part,[<<2,3,3>>,1,2]),
 1550:     %% Constant propagation
 1551:     Bin = <<1,2,3>>,
 1552:     ok = if
 1553: 	     binary_part(Bin,1,1) =:= <<2>> ->
 1554: 		 ok;
 1555: 	     %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 1556: 	     true ->
 1557: 		 error
 1558: 	 end,
 1559:     ok = if
 1560: 	     binary_part(Bin,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1561: 		 ok;
 1562: 	     %% Compiler warning, clause cannot match (expected)
 1563: 	     true ->
 1564: 		 error
 1565: 	 end,
 1566:     ok.
 1567: 
 1568: 
 1569: bptest(B) when length(B) =:= 1337 ->
 1570:     1;
 1571: bptest(B) when binary_part(B,{1,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1572:     1;
 1573: bptest(B) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 1574:     2;
 1575: bptest(B)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1576:     3;
 1577: bptest(_) ->
 1578:     error.
 1579: 
 1580: bptest(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1581:     1;
 1582: bptest(B,A) when binary_part(B,{A,1}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1583:     1;
 1584: bptest(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,1) =:= <<1>> ->
 1585:     2;
 1586: bptest(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,2}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1587:     3;
 1588: bptest(_,_) ->
 1589:     error.
 1590: 
 1591: bptestx(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1592:     1;
 1593: bptestx(B,A) when binary_part(B,A) =:= <<2>> ->
 1594:     1;
 1595: bptestx(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 1596:     2;
 1597: bptestx(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,A) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1598:     3;
 1599: bptestx(_,_) ->
 1600:     error.
 1601: 
 1602: bptesty(B,A) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1603:     1;
 1604: bptesty(B,A) when binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1605:     1;
 1606: bptesty(B,A) when erlang:binary_part(B,1,A) =:= <<1>> ->
 1607:     2;
 1608: bptesty(B,A)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{1,A}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1609:     3;
 1610: bptesty(_,_) ->
 1611:     error.
 1612: 
 1613: bptest(B,A,_C) when length(B) =:= A ->
 1614:     1;
 1615: bptest(B,A,C) when binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<2>> ->
 1616:     1;
 1617: bptest(B,A,C) when erlang:binary_part(B,A,C) =:= <<1>> ->
 1618:     2;
 1619: bptest(B,A,C)  when erlang:binary_part(B,{A,C}) =:= <<3,3>> ->
 1620:     3;
 1621: bptest(_,_,_) ->
 1622:     error.
 1623: 
 1624: -define(FAILING(C),
 1625: 	if
 1626: 	    C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 1627: 	    true -> ok
 1628: 	end,
 1629: 	if
 1630: 	    true, C -> ct:fail(should_fail);
 1631: 	    true -> ok
 1632: 	end).
 1633: 
 1634: bad_constants(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1635:     ?FAILING(false),
 1636:     ?FAILING([]),
 1637:     ?FAILING([a]),
 1638:     ?FAILING([Config]),
 1639:     ?FAILING({a,b}),
 1640:     ?FAILING({a,Config}),
 1641:     ?FAILING(<<1>>),
 1642:     ?FAILING(42),
 1643:     ?FAILING(3.14),
 1644:     ok.
 1645: 
 1646: %% Call this function to turn off constant propagation.
 1647: id(I) -> I.
 1648: 
 1649: check(F, Result) ->
 1650:     case F() of
 1651: 	Result -> ok;
 1652: 	Other ->
 1653: 	    io:format("Expected: ~p\n", [Result]),
 1654: 	    io:format("     Got: ~p\n", [Other]),
 1655: 	    ct:fail(failed)
 1656:     end.
 1657: 
 1658: fc({'EXIT',{function_clause,_}}) -> ok.
